name: New Year's Day
description: The first day of the year in the Gregorian calendar, celebrated with fireworks, parties, and resolutions.

name: National Sticker Day
description: A day to celebrate all things sticky, from bumper stickers to the ones you collected as a kid.

name: National Popcorn Day
description: Whether it's salty, sweet, or buttery, it's the perfect day to enjoy America's favorite movie snack.

name: Martin Luther King Jr. Day
description: A US federal holiday marking the birthday of Martin Luther King Jr., observed on the third Monday of January.

name: National Compliment Day
description: A day dedicated to spreading positivity by giving genuine compliments to friends, family, and strangers.

name: Opposite Day
description: A day where you say the opposite of what you mean. Or is it a day you don't? It's very confusing.

name: Republic Day (India)
description: A national holiday in India commemorating the date on which the Constitution of India came into effect in 1950.

name: Australia Day
description: The official National Day of Australia, marking the anniversary of the 1788 arrival of the First Fleet of British ships.

name: Bubble Wrap Appreciation Day
description: A day dedicated to the simple, stress-relieving joy of popping bubble wrap.

name: International LEGO Day
description: A day celebrating the classic building blocks that have inspired creativity and fun for generations.

name: Data Privacy Day
description: An international event to raise awareness and promote privacy and data protection best practices.

name: Chinese New Year (Lunar New Year)
description: The festival that celebrates the beginning of a new year on the traditional lunisolar Chinese calendar. 2025 is the Year of the Snake.

name: National Puzzle Day
description: A day to challenge your brain with jigsaw puzzles, crosswords, Sudoku, or any other kind of puzzle you enjoy.

name: Groundhog Day
description: A popular tradition in the U.S. and Canada where a groundhog emerging from its burrow predicts the arrival of spring.

name: National Wear Red Day
description: A day to wear red to show support and raise awareness for heart disease.

name: National Pizza Day
description: The perfect excuse to indulge in a slice (or a whole pie) of your favorite pizza.

name: Darwin Day
description: A day to celebrate the anniversary of Charles Darwin's birth and to highlight his contributions to science.

name: World Radio Day
description: A day to celebrate radio as a powerful medium for communication and entertainment.

name: Valentine's Day
description: A day to celebrate romance, love, and friendship by exchanging cards, flowers, and candy.

name: Random Acts of Kindness Day
description: A day to pay it forward and make the world a little brighter through simple acts of kindness.

name: National Drink Wine Day
description: A day to appreciate and enjoy the history and health benefits of wine. Cheers!

name: World Thinking Day
description: A day of international friendship celebrated by Girl Scouts and Girl Guides in over 150 countries.

name: National Chili Day
description: A day to cook up a warm, comforting bowl of chili, whether you like it spicy, mild, with beans, or without.

name: World Compliment Day
description: An opportunity to make someone's day by offering a sincere compliment.

name: National Grammar Day
description: A day for grammar enthusiasts to celebrate and for everyone else to be extra careful with their punctuation.

name: International Women's Day
description: A global day celebrating the social, economic, cultural, and political achievements of women.

name: National Napping Day
description: Observed annually the day after daylight saving time begins, this day encourages a well-deserved nap.

name: Holi (Festival of Colors)
description: A popular Hindu festival, celebrating the arrival of spring, the end of winter, and the blossoming of love.

name: Pi Day
description: Celebrating the mathematical constant π (3.14) with pie, both the mathematical and the edible kind.

name: World Sleep Day
description: An annual event to raise awareness of sleep as a human privilege that is often compromised by modern life.

name: St. Patrick's Day
description: A cultural and religious celebration held on the traditional death date of Saint Patrick, the foremost patron saint of Ireland.

name: National Awkward Moments Day
description: A day to embrace and laugh about the cringe-worthy, awkward moments that happen to us all.

name: International Day of Happiness
description: A day to be happy, as recognized by the United Nations. A great day to focus on what brings you joy.

name: World Poetry Day
description: A day to appreciate and support poets and the art of poetry around the world.

name: International Day of Forests
description: A UN observance to celebrate and raise awareness of the importance of all types of forests.

name: National Puppy Day
description: A day to celebrate the unconditional love and joy that puppies bring to our lives.

name: Waffle Day
description: A day to enjoy the crispy, fluffy, grid-patterned delights known as waffles.

name: World Theatre Day
description: A day to celebrate the value and importance of the art of theatre.

name: Eid al-Fitr
description: The religious holiday celebrated by Muslims worldwide that marks the end of the month-long dawn-to-sunset fasting of Ramadan.

name: World Backup Day
description: A day for people to learn about the increasing role of data in our lives and the importance of regular backups.

name: April Fool's Day
description: A day for pranks and practical jokes. Trust no one!

name: National Walking Day
description: A day to encourage everyone to get out and go for a walk for their physical and mental health.

name: World Health Day

name: National Unicorn Day
description: A day to celebrate the mythical, horned creature that has captivated imaginations for centuries.

name: National Siblings Day
description: A day to honor and appreciate your brothers and sisters.

name: International Day of Human Space Flight (Yuri's Night)
description: A UN day celebrating the anniversary of the first human space flight by Yuri Gagarin on April 12, 1961.

name: National Grilled Cheese Sandwich Day
description: A day dedicated to the simple, comforting, and delicious grilled cheese sandwich.

name: National Scrabble Day
description: A day to play the classic word game and show off your vocabulary.

name: World Art Day
description: An international celebration of the fine arts which was declared by the International Association of Art (IAA).

name: Good Friday
description: A Christian holiday commemorating the crucifixion of Jesus and his death at Calvary.

name: Easter
description: A Christian festival and cultural holiday commemorating the resurrection of Jesus from the dead.

name: National Look-Alike Day
description: A day to find your doppelgänger or dress up to look like your favorite celebrity.

name: Earth Day
description: An annual event to demonstrate support for environmental protection.

name: World Penguin Day
description: A day to learn about and appreciate these amazing flightless birds.

name: World Intellectual Property Day
description: A day to learn about the role that intellectual property (IP) rights play in encouraging innovation and creativity.

name: International Dance Day
description: A global celebration of dance, created to encourage participation and education in dance.

name: National Honesty Day
description: A day to encourage honesty and straightforward communication in politics, relationships, and education.

name: World Password Day
description: A day to promote better password habits and digital security.

name: May the 4th Be With You (Star Wars Day)
description: An unofficial holiday to celebrate the Star Wars franchise. May the Force be with you.

name: Cinco de Mayo
description: Commemorates the Mexican Army's victory over the French Empire at the Battle of Puebla in 1862.

name: National Eat What You Want Day
description: A day to set aside your diet and indulge in your favorite foods without any guilt.

name: Mother's Day (US)
description: A celebration honoring the mother of the family, as well as motherhood, maternal bonds, and the influence of mothers in society.

name: International Museum Day
description: A day to raise awareness on how important museums are in the development of society.

name: World Bee Day
description: A UN day to acknowledge the role of bees and other pollinators for the ecosystem.

name: National Talk Like Yoda Day
description: A fun day it is. Speak like the Jedi Master, you must.

name: National Towel Day

name: Memorial Day (US)
description: A U.S. federal holiday for mourning the U.S. military personnel who have died while serving in the United States armed forces.

name: National Hamburger Day
description: A day to fire up the grill and enjoy a classic American hamburger.

name: World Milk Day
description: A day established by the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations to recognize the importance of milk as a global food.

name: World Environment Day
description: The United Nations' principal vehicle for encouraging worldwide awareness and action for the environment.

name: Eid al-Adha
description: The latter of the two official holidays celebrated within Islam, honoring the willingness of Ibrahim (Abraham) to sacrifice his son.

name: International Tabletop Day
description: A day to celebrate board games, card games, and role-playing games with friends and family.

name: National Donut Day
description: A day to enjoy a donut and celebrate its history, which is tied to The Salvation Army.

name: World Oceans Day
description: A day for humanity to celebrate the ocean and our personal connection to the sea.

name: Father's Day (US)
description: A day of honoring fatherhood and paternal bonds, as well as the influence of fathers in society.

name: International Sushi Day
description: A day to celebrate the Japanese culinary art of sushi.

name: Juneteenth
description: A U.S. federal holiday commemorating the end of slavery in the United States.

name: National Flip Flop Day
description: A day to wear your favorite flip-flops and embrace the casual spirit of summer.

name: World Music Day
description: An annual music celebration that takes place on June 21, with free concerts and events in cities around the world.

name: National Selfie Day
description: A day to snap a selfie and share it with the world.

name: Asteroid Day
description: A UN-sanctioned day to raise public awareness about the asteroid impact hazard.

name: Canada Day
description: The national day of Canada, celebrating the anniversary of the Constitution Act, 1867, which united three colonies into a single country.

name: World UFO Day
description: A day for people to gather and watch the skies for unidentified flying objects.

name: Independence Day (US)
description: A U.S. federal holiday commemorating the Declaration of Independence of the United States on July 4, 1776.

name: World Chocolate Day
description: A day to indulge in the rich, delicious world of chocolate.

name: Bastille Day
description: The national day of France, celebrating the storming of the Bastille in 1789, a major event of the French Revolution.

name: National Mac and Cheese Day
description: A day to celebrate the ultimate comfort food: macaroni and cheese.

name: World Emoji Day
description: A day to celebrate the pictographs that have become a global language.

name: International Day of Friendship
description: A United Nations day that promotes the role that friendship plays in promoting peace.

name: Harry Potter's Birthday
description: A day for fans worldwide to celebrate the birthday of the iconic fictional wizard.

name: International Cat Day
description: A day to celebrate and appreciate our feline friends.

name: National Book Lovers Day
description: A day for book lovers to celebrate their favorite reads and the joy of reading.

name: National Lazy Day
description: The perfect excuse to do absolutely nothing and relax.

name: International Lefthanders Day
description: A day to celebrate the uniqueness and differences of left-handed individuals.

name: Independence Day (India)
description: A national holiday in India, commemorating the nation's independence from the United Kingdom on 15 August 1947.

name: World Photography Day
description: An annual, worldwide celebration of the art, craft, science, and history of photography.

name: Raksha Bandhan
description: A popular Hindu festival celebrating the bond between brothers and sisters.

name: National Dog Day
description: A day to celebrate all dogs, mixed breed and pure.

name: International Bacon Day
description: A day to celebrate and eat bacon. What more needs to be said?

name: International Day of Charity
description: A UN day to recognize the role of charity in alleviating humanitarian crises and human suffering.

name: National Video Games Day
description: A day for gamers to celebrate the art, technology, and fun of video games.

name: Programmers' Day

name: International Talk Like a Pirate Day

name: Batman Day

name: Oktoberfest Opening Day
description: Marks the beginning of the world's largest Volksfest, held annually in Munich, Bavaria, Germany.

name: International Day of Peace
description: A United Nations-sanctioned holiday dedicated to world peace, and specifically the absence of war and violence.

name: Rosh Hashanah
description: The Jewish New Year, a two-day celebration that begins the High Holy Days.

name: World Tourism Day

name: World Heart Day

name: International Podcast Day
description: An international celebration of the power of podcasts and the people who create them.

name: International Coffee Day
description: A day to celebrate and enjoy the world's most popular beverage.

name: Gandhi Jayanti
description: A national festival in India celebrated to mark the occasion of the birthday of Mahatma Gandhi.

name: Yom Kippur
description: Known as the Day of Atonement, it is the holiest day of the year in Judaism.

name: World Space Week (Start)
description: An international celebration of science and technology, and their contribution to the betterment of the human condition.

name: National Taco Day
description: A day to celebrate and eat one of the most popular and versatile foods.

name: World Teachers' Day
description: A day held annually to celebrate and appreciate educators around the world.

name: World Mental Health Day
description: A day for global mental health education, awareness and advocacy against social stigma.

name: National Coming Out Day
description: An annual LGBTQ awareness day to support lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender people in 'coming out of the closet'.

name: World Food Day
description: A day of action dedicated to tackling global hunger and striving to eradicate hunger across the world.

name: Diwali (Festival of Lights)
description: A major festival in Hinduism, Jainism, and Sikhism, symbolizing the victory of light over darkness and good over evil.

name: Back to the Future Day

name: United Nations Day
description: A day marking the anniversary of the entry into force in 1945 of the UN Charter.

name: World Pasta Day
description: A day to celebrate one of the world's favorite and most versatile foods.

name: Halloween
description: A holiday celebrated each year on October 31 with costumes, candy, trick-or-treating, and spooky decorations.

name: World Vegan Day

name: Stranger Things Day
description: A day for fans to celebrate the popular Netflix series, marking the date Will Byers went missing in 1983.

name: World Kindness Day
description: An international holiday that was formed to promote kindness throughout the world.

name: International Men's Day
description: A day to celebrate boys' and men's achievements and contributions, particularly for their contributions to nation, society, and family.

name: Thanksgiving (US)
description: A national holiday in the United States, celebrated on the fourth Thursday of November as a day of giving thanks for the blessing of the harvest.

name: Black Friday
description: An informal name for the Friday following Thanksgiving in the United States, which is regarded as the beginning of the country's Christmas shopping season.

name: Cyber Monday
description: A marketing term for the e-commerce shopping day on the Monday after the Thanksgiving holiday in the United States.

name: International Day of Persons with Disabilities
description: An international observance promoted by the United Nations since 1992 to promote the rights and well-being of persons with disabilities.

name: Human Rights Day
description: The day the United Nations General Assembly adopted, in 1948, the Universal Declaration of Human Rights.

name: Hanukkah (First Day)
description: A Jewish festival commemorating the recovery of Jerusalem and subsequent rededication of the Second Temple, also known as the Festival of Lights.

name: Christmas Eve
description: The evening or entire day before Christmas Day, the festival commemorating the birth of Jesus.

name: Christmas Day
description: An annual festival commemorating the birth of Jesus Christ, observed primarily on December 25 as a religious and cultural celebration.

name: Boxing Day
description: A holiday celebrated the day after Christmas Day, originating in the United Kingdom and celebrated in a number of countries that previously formed part of the British Empire.

name: New Year's Eve
description: The last day of the year, celebrated with parties, social gatherings, and fireworks to ring in the new year.
